title: DP-CopulaGAN: A Differentially Private Synthetic Data Generator Using Copula and Generative Adversarial Networks
description: A Python package for generating differentially private synthetic tabular data using Gaussian copula transformations and Wasserstein Generative Adversarial Networks with gradient penalty (WGAN-GP). The package combines copula-based dependency modeling with formal differential privacy guarantees via DP-SGD, making it suitable for privacy-preserving data release in official statistics, healthcare, and machine learning research.

creators.name: Çırak, Emre
creators.affiliation: Department of Statistics, Gazi University; Turkish Statistical Institute (TURKSTAT)

references: Abadi, M., et al. (2016). Deep learning with differential privacy. CCS 2016.
Gulrajani, I., et al. (2017). Improved training of Wasserstein GANs. NeurIPS 2017.
Nelsen, R. B. (2006). An introduction to copulas. Springer.
Xu, L., et al. (2019). Modeling tabular data using conditional GAN. NeurIPS 2019.
